description: Mobile techniques used by Cerberus, ATT&CK software S0480 v1.1
name: Cerberus (S0480)

techniques.comment: [Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can obtain the device’s contact list.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can obtain a list of installed applications.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can collect SMS messages from a device.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)

[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) has been delivered to the device via websites that prompt the user to “[…] install Adobe Flash Player” and then downloads the malicious APK to the device.(Citation: Forbes Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can update the malicious payload module on command.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)

[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) avoids being analyzed by only activating the malware after recording a certain number of steps from the accelerometer.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can record keystrokes.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)

[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can inject input to grant itself additional permissions without user interaction and to prevent application removal.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)(Citation: CheckPoint Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can generate fake notifications and launch overlay attacks against attacker-specified applications.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) disables Google Play Protect to prevent its discovery and deletion in the future.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can collect the device’s location.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) has pretended to be an Adobe Flash Player installer.(Citation: Forbes Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) uses standard payload and string obfuscation techniques.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can send SMS messages from a device.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) communicates with the C2 server using HTTP.(Citation: CheckPoint Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) hides its icon from the application drawer after being launched for the first time.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can collect device information, such as the default SMS app and device locale.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)(Citation: CheckPoint Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) communicates with the C2 over port 8888.(Citation: CheckPoint Cerberus)
[Cerberus](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0480) can uninstall itself from a device on command.(Citation: Threat Fabric Cerberus)
